column5: With bass season just around the corner and all my rods rigged up and ready to go, I thought that I would share some of the more respectable and photo worthy fish that we ( me and Weedlines ) boated this year. Most fish came off of jerkbaits of various sizes and colours. Some fish fell victom to spoons and spinnerbaits.We even experimented with the new swimbaits that have hit the scene. Enjoy the pics. Heres the first fish of the season......Was this a sign of things to come ?  We started the season off nice and close to home.  A couple of respectable T-dot fish.......    Bumped into this old boot with a jerkbait.Pretty cool to say the least.  Then it was up north to a few new lakes that we always wanted to try, as well as a few old favorites.        These two pics are my favorite.........Solopadler style!     A couple more......    The same fish.....  Well thats my story and Im stickin to it. I hope you all have a great bass season. Now I can concentrate on this.....  and this.....
Holy Tonnage "pikeman"...  that is some serious  metropolitan pike there...
Good fishin Mike!!  No musky??  S.
sweet pike porn!! weedline i see the orange crawdad husky jerk in the one pic, probably not the ones i sold you but i see the success with the same lure! right on!
wOot!  Good job boys!  Thanks for sharing.
Gotta love those toothy critters...
Wow!!! that first TO Pike is a Hog    In the past 2-3 years i still haven't gotten a 40 in Toronto from shore. Thanks for sharing!  -Ben
**DROOLLLSSS AT BASSSS*******
I think I need some bigger lures.
The pictures speak for themselves
nice job man, keep that other lake hush hush
You are too good at fishing!  lol, great pictures and well you really know how to catch em!  Thanks for sharing, MTBF
Wow!!! Those are some serious fish you guys caught, very nice!!!!
Nice fish...but...we have the same boat, cept mine has a 60 on it.
Wow, just wow.
great gators
Beauty report, thanks...
Great looking gators msp Congratulations to both of you  Real fine start to the season!!! Thanks for sharing Leechman
Those are some serious lookin' pike....congrats!!
Man, you never fail to impress with the Pike...thanks for sharing
